refnamediv.refpurpose: Writes data to the named software bus.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Write to a channel of the named software bus. Implies declaring the channel with imod=2 (see also chn_k, chn_a, and chn_S).

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: Sname -- a string that indicates which named channel of the software bus to write.
Sname[] -- an array of string that indicates which named channels of the software bus to write to.
ival -- the control value to write at i-time.
ival[] -- an array of control values to write at i-time.
Sval -- the string value to write at i-time.
Sval[] -- an array of string values to write at i-time.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: kval -- the control value to write at performance time.
aval -- the audio signal to write at performance time.

Sval -- the string value to write at perf-time. The opcode chnset with strings works at both i- and perf-time, whereas chnsetks works only a perf-time. Channel contents are only updated if the string variable is modified.
kval[] -- an array of control values to write at performance time.
aval[] -- an array of audio vectors to write at performance time.

note.para: Although it is possible to loop through channel names from an array with chnget and chnset, using the array based channel opcodes is more efficient.

refsect1.title: Example
refsect1.para: The example shows the software bus being used to write pitch information to a controlling program.

informalexample.programlisting:
sr = 44100 kr = 100 ksmps = 1
instr 1 a1 in kp,ka pitchamdf a1 chnset kp, "pitch" endin
